topics.title: 00: Overview
topics.objectives: Preview the module, get a flavour of Kotlin. Introduce the Android platform

los.title: Module Overview
los.objectives: Outline of the structure and content of the module

los.title: Convergence
los.objectives: A simple algorithm expressed in Java, Groovy, Swift and Kotlin

los.title: Android Overview
los.objectives: Introduction to the Android platform - its goals and major components

los.title: Lab-00 Studio
los.objectives: Download and configure Android Studio. Generate and run a sample application.

los.title: Archaeological Fieldwork
los.objectives: Specification, grading guidelines and schedule for the Assignment

los.title: Project Submission Template
los.objectives: An archive of a word document to be submitted with assignment 2

los.title: Assignment 2 Submission
los.objectives: Moodle assignment dropbox for Assignment 2

topics.title: 01: Activities
topics.objectives: Take the first steps with a Kotlin Android. Explore the source in detail.

los.title: Android Platform, Components & Activities
los.objectives: Key features of the platform, the principle components + the activity model

los.title: Android: Foundation
los.objectives: A first look at the structure of a simple Kotlin Android application

los.title: Lab-01 Activities
los.objectives: Layout the PlacemarkActivity - supporting create/edit of placemarks

topics.title: 02: Adapters
topics.objectives: Look at Kotlin in more depth. Deep dive into some of its features. Extend the app to manage lists of placemarks using the adapter pattern.

los.title: Kotlin Structure
los.objectives: The fundamental characteristics of the language

los.title: Basic Syntax
los.objectives: Rapid tour of the basic syntax of Kotlin

los.title: Kotlin Deep Dive
los.objectives: A deep dive into some key Kotlin features: Data Classes & Lambdas

los.title: Android Application Object
los.objectives: This class enables a global application object to be defined, accessible from all activities

los.title: Recycler View + Adapters
los.objectives: Managing lists is facilitated by the RecyclerView + Adapters - 2 key patterns in Android development

los.title: Lab-02 Adapters
los.objectives: Introduce new activity to display a list of placemarks. Support adding to this list.

topics.title: 03: Models
topics.objectives: Examine key Kotlin Idioms. Start comparing simple Java & Kotlin statements. Introduce a more complete model into Placemark.

los.title: Kotlin Idioms
los.objectives: Kotlin Idioms

los.title: Idioms
los.objectives: A tour of the common idioms in Kotlin

los.title: J2K Variables & Expressions
los.objectives: Snippets of the same code in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Toolbar
los.objectives: The Android Support Library implements AppCompatActivity + a range of general purpose components, including a ToolBar

los.title: Memory Store
los.objectives: Abstract the Placemarks data structure into PlacemarkStore interface + in-memory implementation.

los.title: Adapter + Listener
los.objectives: Equip the Adapter with a Listener interface. Use this interface to communicate from the adapter to the host Activity

los.title: Parcelable
los.objectives: Encapsulate model data for transmission between Activities

los.title: Lab-03 Models
los.objectives: Application object + Model classes to manage placemarks.

topics.title: 04: Images
topics.objectives: A more detailed look at the fundamental types in Kotlin. How to manage images in android, including selecting and displaying images from the phone gallery.

los.title: Types
los.objectives: Summary of the basic types in the Kotlin programming language

los.title: J2K Collections
los.objectives: Collection examples: Java & Kotlin equivalents

los.title: Resources
los.objectives: A general term for all layout, strings, bitmaps and other XML artefacts in an Android Project

los.title: Model Updates
los.objectives: Creating and updating a Placemark. Updating the placemark list.

los.title: Images
los.objectives: Support selecting image from phone gallery, and then displaying them in an activity.

los.title: Lab-04 Images
los.objectives: Allow an image to be selected from the phones photos, and stored with the placemark

topics.title: 05: Maps
topics.objectives: Review Kotlin Packages + Control flow. Introducing Google Maps into and android app.

los.title: Kotlin Packages
los.objectives: Source files start with a package declaration. This can be used to access (import) features from the source file.

los.title: Kotlin Control Flow
los.objectives: if, when, for and while statements

los.title: J2K Control Flow
los.objectives: Control flow examples in Java and Kotlin

los.title: App Structure
los.objectives: Key classes and relationships in the application.

los.title: Map Activity
los.objectives: Google Map Activity can be inserted into an app via a Wizard from Studio. API Keys must be acquired from google directly.

los.title: Cameras & Markers
los.objectives: These abstractions enable the map view to be manipulated programatically, and facilitate direct manipulation by the user.

los.title: Lab-05 MapActivity
los.objectives: Include a MapActivity, enabling the user to select the location of the placemark

topics.title: 06: Persistence
topics.objectives: Kotlin Classes in detail. New Placemark Store class to save placemarks to the file system.

los.title: Kotlin Classes I
los.objectives: Kotlin Classes I

los.title: Classes & Inheritance
los.objectives: In kotlin, classes are more concise, explicit and fine-grained then Java

los.title: J2K: Functions
los.objectives: Functions in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Persistence
los.objectives: Korlin classes & Inheritance. Storing and retrieving placemarks. JSON file serialization

los.title: File Formats
los.objectives: When a simple file persistence strategy, CSV, Name/Value, YAML, XML & JSON are all potential candidate formats for file-based storage.

los.title: JSON
los.objectives: A detailed look at the syntax of JSON

los.title: JSON Store
los.objectives: A new PlacemarkStore implementation - PlacemarkJSONStore - to persist placemarks to a JSON file.

los.title: Lab-06 JSON
los.objectives: Save and restore placemarks from a JSON formatted file

topics.title: 07: Layouts
topics.objectives: Kotlin properties, fields, & interfaces. Constraint Layout. Introduce activity to display all placemark locations + details.

los.title: Properties & Fields
los.objectives: Kotlin properties and fields offer a richer set of features and variants over Java

los.title: J2K : Classes
los.objectives: Classes in Java & Kotlin

los.title: Layouts
los.objectives: Constraint layout. Managing embedded maps. Initialisation and manipulation.

los.title: Constraint Layout
los.objectives: ConstraintLayout allows you to create large and complex layouts with a flat view

los.title: Overall Map Activity
los.objectives: Introduce an activity to display all placemarks on a single map.

los.title: Lab-07 MapView
los.objectives: Display all placemarks on a map in a new activity

topics.title: 08: Presenters
topics.objectives: Introducing Model View Presenter - a pattern to enhance separation of concerns in the Activity classes

los.title: Interfaces
los.objectives: Kotlin interfaces largely follow Java 8 conventions

los.title: Visibility
los.objectives: Classes, objects, interfaces, constructors, functions, properties and their setters can have visibility modifiers.

los.title: Model View Presenter
los.objectives: Model View Presenter

los.title: Model View Presenter
los.objectives: Overview of Model View Controller & Model View Presenter patterns

los.title: View/Presenter
los.objectives: Detailed review of conversion of PlacemarkActivity to PlacemarkView & PlacemarkPresenter

los.title: Lab-08a MVP I
los.objectives: Refactor Activities to use the Model View Presenter pattern

los.title: BaseView / BasePresenter
los.objectives: BaseView / BasePresenter

los.title: BaseView BasePresenter
los.objectives: Factor out common MVP features into BaseView/Presenter classes

los.title: Lab-08b MVP II
los.objectives: Complete the presenter pattern implementation, introducing BaseView & BasePresenter classes

topics.title: 09: Location
topics.objectives: Kotlin visibility & extensions. Determine the devices current location & resolve in a map.

los.title: Extensions
los.objectives: The ability to extend a class with new functionality without having to inherit from the class

los.title: Data Classes
los.objectives: Classes whose main purpose is to hold data.

los.title: Sealed Classes
los.objectives: Sealed classes are used for representing restricted class hierarchies

los.title: Last Known Location
los.objectives: Configure Markers and listen for marker events

los.title: Location API
los.objectives: The location APIs available in Google Play services

los.title: Current Location
los.objectives: Using the Fused Location Provider to recover the last known location

los.title: Lab-09a Location
los.objectives: When creating a new placemark, use the current location as the starting point.

los.title: Current Location Tracking
los.objectives: Configure Markers and listen for marker events

los.title: Location Tracking
los.objectives: Track the location, in real time, of the device.

los.title: Lab-09b Tracking
los.objectives: Extend the location facility to track location in real time.

topics.title: 10: Rooms
topics.objectives: Kotlin Data & Sealed classes, Generics. Android Architecture Components. The Room framework. PlacemarkStoreRoom implementation

los.title: Nested Classes & Enums
los.objectives: Classes can be nested in other classes. Enums provide an elegant notation for a limited set of constant values

los.title: Objects
los.objectives: Objects, Singletons & Companion objects

los.title: Delegation
los.objectives: A class can implement an interface Base by delegating all of its public members to a specified object

los.title: AndroidX
los.objectives: AndroidX

los.title: Jetpack & AndroidX
los.objectives: AndroidX is the open-source project that the Android team uses to develop, test, package, version and release libraries within Jetpack

los.title: Semantic Version Management
los.objectives: A simple set of rules and requirements that dictate how version numbers are assigned and incremented

los.title: Lab-10a AndroidX
los.objectives: Migrate to AndroidX + manage library versions more optimally

los.title: Rooms
los.objectives: The Room persistence library provides an abstraction layer over SQLite

los.title: Rooms in Placemark
los.objectives: Implementation of PlacemarkStoreRoom, which stores placemarks in a SQLite database

los.title: Lab-10b Rooms
los.objectives: Introduce a new PlacemarkStore implementation to persist to an SQLite database

topics.title: 11: Firebase
topics.objectives: Introducing Firebase Authentication, Database and Storage services.

los.title: Firebase Authentication
los.objectives: Firebase Authentication

los.title: Firebase
los.objectives: A set of cloud services from google delivering app infrastructure

los.title: Firebase Auth
los.objectives: Signup, Login and Logout in Placemark

los.title: Lab-11a Firebase Auth
los.objectives: Authenticate users against the Firebase Authentication service

los.title: Realtime Database
los.objectives: Storing & Retrieving placemarks to/from Firebase

los.title: Lab-11b Firebase Database
los.objectives: Store placemarks in Firebase Realtime Database

los.title: Storage
los.objectives: Storing & Retrieving placemark images

los.title: Lab-11c Firebase Storage
los.objectives: Store images in Firebase Storage

topics.title: Placemark Repo
topics.objectives: This is a complete repo of the Placemark application, including tags for all labs
